result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to count two.

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO COUNT ONE AND TWO:  Same as probation conditions.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
No contact with Susan B. or within one block of her residence.

Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision to be paid by end of supervision.  Failure to pay will reslt in a civil judgment.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  Failure to pay by end of supervision is civil judgment.
  If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

07-27-15/ Timothy M Witkowiak
The Court ordered that the term of Initial Confinement for Count 2 is commuted to 1 year and 6 months of  Initial Confinement for Count 2.   All other aspects of the sentence shall remain the same
Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to count one.

miscConds.notes: Conditions as stated on count one.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund notice and Affidavit mailed to surety 12/04/2014. LJ

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Susan B.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program, but is NOT eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 1 & 2 and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- Successfully complete Mental Health evaluation.
- Mental health division of probation/parole.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Susan B or within one block of her residence.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Victim Impact Statement

Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Complaint Waukesha County 2005 Case

Defendant Jason P Campbell in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Jason P Campbell in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.  Original filed in case 14CF420.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.  Originals filed in case 14CF420.

Attorney Kiley Zellner in court, defendant Jason Patrick Campbell not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing, however defense is requesting time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason P Campbell in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Jason P Campbell in custody.  Michael Lonski for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on NGI report.  Parties do not challenge the report, which found no evidence to a reasonable degree of medical certainty that the defendant lacked substantial capacity to understand the wrongfulness of his acts or conform his behavior to the requirements of the law.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Forensic report dated 10/13/2014 received and filed.  Parties notified.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES the defense motion for bail reduction.

Defendant Jason P Campbell in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Jason P Campbell in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. John Pankiewicz be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Status Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for 09-03-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason P Campbell in court with student Intern Steve Elmer under the supervision of attorney Caitlin Firer for Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jason P Campbell in custody.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective James Campbell.   Court took judical notice of certified documents (bail bond only) regarding case #14CF420 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Susan B. and the alley near 2820 N. 73rd St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Jason P Campbell in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jason P Campbell in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
